public class Calculator

Operation with numbers

The Calculator program implements an application that calculates the values â€‹â€‹of two numbers over which the operations of addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division are applied.

  • Method Details

    • calculate

      public void calculate​(java.lang.Double value, char operator) throws DivisionByZeroException, NotSupportedOperationException
      This method performs the basics of a mathematical operation on two operands. It receives two parameters, the first of which must be a Double value and the second a character. The second parameter can only take the value '+', '-', '*', '/'. Everything else is illegal. Once the send operator is applied, the result is placed in the currentValue.
      Parameters:
      value - This is the first paramter to calculate method. Must be of type Double.
      operator - This is the second paramter to calculate method. Must be of type char. This operator can only be a character '+', '-', '+', '/'. Other characters are not allowed. In the case of division by zero, an exception is thrown. That exception is DivisionByZeroException.
      Throws:
      DivisionByZeroException - this exception is thrown in case the value is zero.
      NotSupportedOperationException - This exception is thrown in case the operator is not allowed. So, if we enter anything for an operator that is not '+'or '-'or '*' or '/', this exception is discarded.
      See Also:
      DivisionByZeroException, NotSupportedOperationException

    • getCurrentValue

      public java.lang.Double getCurrentValue()
      Returns:
      A value that is of type Double.

    • setCurrentValue

      public void setCurrentValue​(java.lang.Double currentValue)

      currentValue - Sets the value to some Double value.
